ygData.subject: Re: Hey this sounded interesting..
ygData.msgSnippet: I m sorry but in melee a bard will outdamage a cleric or shaman any day. Especially one with weapons that have procs that go off like mad from the high dex
ygData.messageBody:
I'm sorry but in melee a bard will outdamage a cleric or shaman any day.
Especially one with weapons that have procs that go off like mad from the
high dex songs. Believe me they come no where close to melee with the
hyhbrid classes. You have to remeber that Verant's definition of a hybrid is
a mix of skills not weapons or armor which leaves priests to not be hybrids,
by their definition. If you want classify the classes it's a lot easier to
think of Pure Casters as War Mages and Priests as healers.

Naeeldar

-----Original Message-----
From: Kimes, Dean W. <Dean_Kimes@...>
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com' <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Friday, October 01, 1999 11:32 AM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Hey this sounded interesting..


>From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
>
>My point was they are as much of hybrids as bards because they also have
>reasonably strong melee skills/abilities, but not as strong as
>rangers/paladins/shadowknights (neither do bards) and good casting
>abilities. It really applies more to clerics and shamans as druids are
more
>limited by their poor armor.
>
> Kitasi
>

>From: Naeeldar [mailto:jackal@...]

>
>Naeeldar
